comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Joe Mandot (check spelling) was a Los Angeles-based featherweight boxer in the 1910s and 1920s: www.boxrec.com/list_bouts.php?human_id=229207&cat=boxer You've got another photo of Mandot (under that spelling) here: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2515732069/

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Hi pennylrichardsca: Thank you for the correction on the spelling of the boxer's name.  We will update the information and reload the description.

comment.author: 46209981@N00
comment._content: I love the hair, so slick and ready for action!

comment.author: 30085166@N00
comment._content: I don't think this is the Mexican featherweight Joe Mandot, who fought from 1922 to 1928, but the American lightweight Joe Mandot, whose ring career ran from 1909 to 1921. See this more recently posted Bain photo of Joe Mandot.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3159320973/] I started a biography of him for Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Marceline_Mandot Joseph Marceline Mandot (August 3, 1890 - 1956) was a featherweight boxing champion from New Orleans. He was born in New Orleans, and was NOT Mexican.
